newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-STEVE WAUGH HOLDS ENGLAND AT BAY WITH 102.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-STEVE WAUGH HOLDS ENGLAND AT BAY WITH 102.

text.p: Steve Waugh held England at bay with a defiant, unbeaten 102 for Australia on the opening day of the third test at Old Trafford on Thursday.
An impressive debut by paceman Dean Headley, who took three wickets, and five catches by wicketkeeper Alec Stewart reduced Australia to 160 for seven after they won the toss.
However, Waugh's grit and application brought his 13th test century just before the close when Australia were 224 for seven.
Headley, whose father Ron and grandfather George both played tests for West Indies, removed Australian captain Mark Taylor (2), opener Matthew Elliott (40) and Michael Bevan (7).
Waugh frustrated England's attempts to wrap up the innings, sharing an unfinished eighth wicket stand of 64 with paceman Paul Reiffel.
